hc.server.msb

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • Processor
      • hc.server.msb.Robot

  • public abstract class Robot
extends Processor
    Robot is a intelligent control unit, which manage zero or multiple Device(s).

    Through Message, robot communicates with devices.

    When a user want to control or operate a Robot from Mlet, HTMLMlet or CtrlResponse, please invoke ProjectContext.getRobot(String) and operate(long, Object),

    Important : you can not bypass Robot to operate Device directly from Mlet, HTMLMlet or CtrlResponse.

    • The Message.getDevID() returns Reference Device ID(not real device ID), if the Message is received in Robot or dispatched from Robot.
    • The Message.getDevID() returns real device ID, if the Message is received in Device or dispatched from Device.
    • After active and apply HAR project, Reference Device ID of Robot in HAR project must refer to real device ID, we call it binding. If there is a Reference Device ID which is not binded, the binding dialog will be popped up before starting up HAR project.
    • a Converter is required if the Message between Robot and Device need to be converted and adapted.
    • A real device ID may be referenced by more than one Reference Device ID. For example, a temperature device initiative publish current temperature to all robots by Device.dispatch(Message, boolean).
    • Robot is the only way to drive Device, no matter they are in same HAR project or not. To access Robot instance in Mlet or CtrlResponse, please invoke ProjectContext.getRobot(String) and operate(long, Object).
    • Message is intermediary between Robot and Device, not intermediary between Mlet(or CtrlResponse) and Device. You can't get a instance of Message outside of Robot, Converter and Device.
    See Also:
    Device, Message

    • Method Detail

      • addRobotListener

        public void addRobotListener(RobotListener listener)
        add a listener to receive RobotEvent.

        if a RobotListener is added in project level, it will be executed in project level.
        if a RobotListener is added in session level, it will be executed in session level, and it will gone automatically after ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.

        it is thread safe.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        removeRobotListener(RobotListener), dispatchRobotEvent(RobotEvent), ProjectContext.isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • buildRobotEvent

        protected RobotEvent buildRobotEvent(String propertyName,
                                     Object oldValue,
                                     Object newValue)
        build a RobotEvent instance.

        Note :
        it is recyclable, please don't keep any reference of it in Robot or RobotListener.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the property name of event.
        oldValue - the old value of property of current event. Maybe null.
        newValue - the new value of property of current event. Maybe null.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        dispatchRobotEvent(RobotEvent), addRobotListener(RobotListener), removeRobotListener(RobotListener)

      • declareReferenceDeviceID

        public abstract String[] declareReferenceDeviceID()
        all the Reference Device ID names those are used in this robot, each one of them will correspond to a real device ID after binding.

        Note : it is allowed that a Robot without Reference Device ID.
        Returns:
        all the Reference Device ID names those are used in this robot.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        getDeviceCompatibleDescription(String)

      • dispatch

        protected void dispatch(Message msg,
                        boolean isInitiative)
        dispatch a Message to a device asynchronous.

        to get instance of the msg, invoke getFreeMessage(String)

        Note :
        the msg can't be dispatched more than one time.
        the msg will be recycled and clean after consumed, please do NOT keep any reference of it.

        to print log of creating/converting/transferring/recycling of message, please enable [Option/Developer/log MSB message].
        Parameters:
        msg - the Message will be dispatched to device(s).
        isInitiative -
        false : answer passively, passive mode is invoked generally in method response(Message) after Message is received.
        true : dispatch initiative, initiative mode is invoked generally in method operate(long, Object).
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        waitFor(Message, long), Device.dispatch(Message, boolean)

      • dispatchRobotEvent

        protected void dispatchRobotEvent(RobotEvent event)
        dispatch an event to all RobotListener no matter it is in session level or in project level.

        it is synchronized,

        to get new instance of RobotEvent, please invoke buildRobotEvent(String, Object, Object).

        Important :
        the event will be recycled and clean after consumed, and you will get it again from buildRobotEvent(String, Object, Object). please do NOT keep any reference of it.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        addRobotListener(RobotListener), removeRobotListener(RobotListener), buildRobotEvent(String, Object, Object)

      • getDeviceCompatibleDescription

        public abstract DeviceCompatibleDescription getDeviceCompatibleDescription(String referenceDeviceID)
        return an instance of DeviceCompatibleDescription about device compatible of referenceDeviceID.

        the description is used for auto-binding to real devices.
        Parameters:
        referenceDeviceID -
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        declareReferenceDeviceID(), Converter.getUpDeviceCompatibleDescription(), Device.getDeviceCompatibleDescription()

      • getFreeMessage

        protected Message getFreeMessage(String ref_dev_id)
        get a Message from recycling pool.

        The message will be converted by Converter or not depends on binding.
        Parameters:
        ref_dev_id - the Reference Device ID which the message is dispatched to.
        Returns:

      • getIoTDesc

        public String getIoTDesc()
        return the description of Robot.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.3

      • getProjectContext

        public ProjectContext getProjectContext()
        get the ProjectContext instance of current project.
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.0

      • operate

        public abstract Object operate(long functionID,
                               Object parameter)
        operate the Robot to do some business from caller,

        for example, adjust the temperature to 28℃, then the parameter is integer object with value 28, and functionID may be 1.

        the method is the only way to operate Robot to drive Device from UI, for example CtrlResponse, HTMLMlet/Mlet, Dialog, Assistant.

        to get Robot instance, invoke ProjectContext.getRobot(String).

        Important :
        the implementation of this method must be able to be executed in session level and project level.
        Parameters:
        functionID -
        parameter - it can NOT be a Message. it is recommended to use the primitive types and their corresponding object wrapper classes and AnalysableRobotParameter to help server for Assistant.

        NOTE :
        the instance of AnalysableRobotParameter is NOT recyclable, because server will analyst it background.
        Returns:
        it can NOT be a Message.
        it is recommended to use the primitive types and their corresponding object wrapper classes and AnalysableRobotParameter.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • removeRobotListener

        public boolean removeRobotListener(RobotListener listener)
        remove a listener.

        it is thread safe.

        if a RobotListener is added in project level, it can be removed in session level.
        if a RobotListener is added in session level, it will gone automatically after ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT, or it should be removed in session level.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        Returns:
        true means successful removed.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        addRobotListener(RobotListener), dispatchRobotEvent(RobotEvent), ProjectContext.isCurrentThreadInSessionLevel()

      • response

        public abstract void response(Message msg)
        response Message msg, which is dispatched from Device.dispatch(Message, boolean) (may be converted by Converter)
        Parameters:
        msg - dispatched from Device (or may be converted by Converter)

      • shutdown

        public abstract void shutdown()
        shutdown the Robot

        this method is invoked by server after ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_PROJ_SHUTDOWN
        Since:
        7.0

      • startup

        public abstract void startup()
        start up and initialize the Robot.

        this method is invoked by server before ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_PROJ_STARTUP
        Since:
        7.0

      • waitFor

        protected Message waitFor(Message msg,
                          long timeout)
        waiting for responding a Message.

        it is synchronous.

        to print log of creating/converting/transferring/recycling of message, please enable [Option/Developer/log MSB message].
        Parameters:
        msg - the request Message.
        timeout - the maximum time to wait in milliseconds. Zero means never time out.
        Returns:
        null if it is not processed or time is out.
        Since:
        7.0
        See Also:
        dispatch(Message, boolean)
